attributes.name: Abraham Lincoln Birthplace National Historical Park
attributes.description: For over a century people from around the world have come to rural Central Kentucky to honor the humble beginnings of our 16th president, Abraham Lincoln. His early life on Kentucky's frontier shaped his character and prepared him to lead the nation through Civil War. Visit our country's first memorial to Lincoln, built with donations from young and old, and the site of his childhood home.

media.title: The Memorial Building with fall colors
media.altText: The Memorial Building surrounded by fall colors
media.caption: Over 200,000 people a year come to walk up the steps of the Memorial Building to visit the site where Abraham Lincoln was born

media.title: The Memorial Building
media.altText: The first memorial erected to honor Abraham Lincoln
media.caption: The Memorial Building constructed on the traditional site of the birth of Abraham Lincoln.

media.title: The Symbolic Birth Cabin of Abraham Lincoln
media.altText: The symbolic birth cabin on the traditional site of the birth of Abraham Lincoln.
media.caption: The symbolic birth cabin of Abraham Lincoln.

media.title: Statue of the Lincoln Family in the Visitor Center
media.altText: Statue of the Lincoln family in the park's Visitor Center
media.caption: Visitors to the park can view the statue of the Lincoln family.

attributes.name: Zion National Park
attributes.description: Follow the paths where people have walked for thousands of years. Gaze up at massive sandstone cliffs of cream, pink, and red that soar into a brilliant blue sky. Experience wilderness in a narrow slot canyon. Zionâ€™s unique array of plants and animals will enchant you as you absorb the rich history of the past and enjoy the excitement of present-day adventures.

media.title: The Watchman
media.altText: A triangular sandstone mountain overlooks green and yellow foliage. A cloudy blue sky is overhead.
media.caption: The Watchman in Zion Canyon

media.title: The Towers of the Virgin
media.altText: The sun sets behind large red and white towers of sandstone.
media.caption: The Towers of the Virgin in Zion Canyon

media.title: Zion Canyon Visitor Center
media.altText: A sandstone and glass building surrounded by tall trees with a mountain behind it.
media.caption: The Zion Canyon Visitor Center is a great place to stop to learn about the park!

media.title: The Narrows
media.altText: Tall, red, sandstone walls enclose a narrow river.
media.caption: The Narrows can be accessed at the end of Riverside Walk, just follow the river.

media.title: Kolob Arch
media.altText: A red sandstone arch under a clear blue sky.
media.caption: Deep in Zion's Wilderness site Kolob Arch, one of the largest free-standing arches in the world.
